reviewText: this is a great DVD for those who luv astronomy

Very good as far as observations are concerned, not so good on theoretical issues, where the host simply states the conventional wisdom.  The lectures are quite technical, but with many illustrations.  You will learn more about radio astronomy than you thought possible.  As to his puzzlement about the Smith Hydrogen Cloud and others, it's obvious to me, a theoretical physicist, that these clouds are simply immature Globular Clusters on their way into being captured by our Galaxy or others.
